entry.title: Change the tax customer wise in SAP CCO?
entry.content:
Hi, 
Is it possible to change the tax of the receipt in CCO, based on the tax setup maintained in SAP Business One? We are using North America Tax localization in CCO, and the requirement is that the tax should change according to the state of that selected customer in CCO. 

For this, do we also need to add the tax of all states in each POS? 

Appreciate the response, 

SAP Customer Checkout  SAP Business One

entry.title: Alteração da data de documento recalculado os valores dos itens
entry.content:
Good morning,

My scenario is as follows: my supplier sends me an invoice in thousands, and I enter it into the UN. They work with 9 decimal places, and in SAP I can only use 6. So, when entering the invoice, there is a small difference in value, so my user changes the “Total MC” field so that the value matches the invoice. When he uses the “copy to” > collect button, a mirror of the document is created, including the value that was changed, but when changing the Document Data, SAP B1 recalculates this field. The question is: is this standard system behavior or a bug?

I am counting on your help.

entry.title: AP Reserve Invoice amendment in SAP Business one
entry.content:
We have a scenario, wherein Purchase Order is copied to AP Reserve Invoice and then Payment is processed against Invoice.

Due to last minute supply chain requirement, changes to the original warehouse and delivery date in either PO or AP Reserve Invoice is requested, but SAP Business One doesn't allow to both of these updates.

What is best way to handle this scenario?

 

Thanks in advance

BS

entry.title: SAP Mobile App IOS Version: 1.11.23 - Permission Denied
entry.content:
I am having trouble running the iOS version of the “Business One v.1.11.23” application, which is giving an authorization denied error when accessing it.

The Android version is working fine.

The software version is SAP Business One version 10.

Have you had this problem before or do you know how to solve it?

Thank you

 

Best regards,
Ricardo Torres

entry.title: Assistance Required to Modify NACHA File Format as per Bank Requirements
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

I have a requirement to modify the NACHA file as per the bank’s specifications. The bank requires both the Credit and Debit lines to be included within the Entry Detail Record (6) section.

According to their clarification:

  • A line starting with “22” represents the Credit line, which records the credit side of the transaction (e.g., the vendor or payee account being credited).

  • A line starting with “27” represents the Debit line, which records the debit side of the transaction (e.g., the company’s account being debited).

By default, the standard NACHA file only includes the credit line information. I have modified the file to add a separate section for the debit lines, and it now correctly displays both credit and debit lines.

However, I have encountered an issue in the Batch Control Total (8) section. The field “Entry / Addenda Count” currently shows only the total number of credit lines, whereas it should display the total count of both credit and debit lines. Similarly, the “Entry Hash” field is also calculating only the total of credit lines, and it should reflect the combined total of both credit and debit entries.

Due to these discrepancies, the corresponding totals in the File Control Record (9) section are also incorrect.

I have attached a sample output file provided by the bank for your reference. Could you please guide me on how to adjust the NACHA file logic to include both credit and debit lines in the Entry / Addenda Count and Entry Hash fields?

Thank you for your assistance.

entry.title: Foreign currency decimal places setting
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I have two customers whose decimal settings for the USD currency are the same, and both have USD customers as well.
However, on the payment page, the number of decimal places shown in the “Payment on Account” field is different between them.
Question : Could you please advise which setting might be causing this discrepancy?

Update:

Here is the information about the decimal place settings and SAP versions for these two customers.

1). SAP Business One 10.0 version for SAP HANA (10.00.230) SP 2311 (64-bit)

2). SAP Business One 10.0 (10.00.180) FP 2111 (64-bit)

 

 

We also have another customer who is using the MSSQL version of SAP. However, similar to the customer using the HANA version, they also have decimal places.
SAP version: SAP Business One 10.0 (10.00.200) FP 2208 (64-bit)

 

 

Best regards,
Rita

entry.title: Purchase Order Approval - Approve and Add option
entry.content: When I select the approve and add option whilst approving purchase orders my SAP shuts down.  I am able to use the approve and add option when approving sales orders without any issues though.  Has anyone else experienced this?

entry.title: Need to scrap fixed assets in current fiscal year but last depreciation was done in previous periods
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have this request to scrap some assets in this financial year 2025, but the assets were last depreciated in June 2022.

When I try to scrap it for June 2025, I get the error
Fiscal year 2025 is not enabled for fixed assets; change the fiscal year.

Should I re-do a fiscal year change and try to post the retirement document again? They need to scrap it in thsi year as the Fiscal year 2022 were signed off by the auditors. 
Has anyone had this issue and know of a workaround? 

Thank you,
Jerusha

entry.title: Allocation of stock for future / subscriptions sales orders
entry.content:
Our website displays current stock availability for all SKUs offered for sale.

We allow back orders for more stock than we have but also get orders from customers for, say, the next three months, or an ongoing monthly subscription.

We need auto allocation of free stock for day to day orders to process swiftly through SAP.

Is there ay way of preventing immediate allocation of free stock to orders with forward delivery dates?

At the moment these orders typically take all available stock which results in an out of stock message on the website.

entry.title: I CAN'T UPDATE BUDGET WİTH DTW
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I would like to update values in certain budget accounts in SAP B1 HANA that I previously imported from scratch using a DTW template. For this, I prepared the OBGT and BGT1 templates again and uploaded them to the system, but the values I want to update are not reflected in the budget tables. In addition, the previous values are being cleared. However, when I query the OBGT and BGT1 tables using a SELECT statement, I can see the values I want to update in the query results.

Could you please assist me with this issue?

Thank you and best regards.

entry.title: Sap business one - DTW Payment Methosd
entry.content:
We have an issue with the DTW files for updating BP payment methods:

  • OCRD → to update the default payment method

  • CRD2 → to update the “Include” flag

For the second file, since we needed to remove and add flags, it was loaded from scratch, without using LineNum for updates.

  • First company → the upload left only the correct “Include” flags

  • Second company → the same upload added the new flags but did not remove the old ones

Why does this happen?

entry.title: Difference between freight charges and landed costs during purchase
entry.content:
Hello,

Can you please explain the difference between freight charges and landed costs? I’ve noticed that SAP provides separate screens for both, even though they are both additional costs incurred during the purchasing process and can be capitalized into inventory, thereby increasing the item cost.

For freight charges, there’s an option to decide whether or not to include the freight in the item cost by using the “Fixed Asset/Stock” checkbox. My understanding is that if the “Stock” checkbox is selected, the freight amount should be capitalized — meaning it will be added to the item cost and not immediately posted to an expense account. The expense will then be recognized later when the item is issued or sold. If the “Stock” checkbox is unchecked, the freight charges are posted directly to an expense account without affecting the item cost.

I created one freight line with the “Stock” checkbox checked. However, when I added a GRPO, the system gave me an error saying that certain G/L accounts were not defined. I was under the impression that when the “Stock” checkbox is selected, there’s no need to book any expense because the freight is capitalized. But I noticed that it only works if I define an expense clearing account, and in that case, the system posts a credit to that expense clearing account. This is confusing to me — if the cost is capitalized, why does it still need to post to an expense clearing account?

Is my understanding correct so far? And how does this behavior differ from how landed costs work in SAP?

entry.title: SAP Business One : Unit price initialization in a sales order item
entry.content:
I would need to initialize the unit price to zero in sales order item (only at creation and when the product code is specified) for a specific price list despite this price list have specified alternative price in in different currencies.

The standard set zero in the unit price on sales order item only if all the prices in price list are zero. If a price is specified this price is get and used in the sales order item.

In short it can be realized a sort of ABAP Process Before Output with SAP  Business One (SAP HANA ver.)?

If yes do you have any source code example that can helps?

Thanks a lot in advance for your collaboration and Help

Regards

Francesco

entry.title: How to make an Addon layout
entry.content:
Dear SAP B1 community

Appreciate your support on the below case:

We have developed an add-on that includes a UDO (User-Defined Object) screen.
After successfully importing the add-on, we are trying to import a layout for this UDO via the Report and Layout Manager.

However, we noticed that neither the add-on name nor the UDO name appears under the Add-on Layouts section in the Report and Layout Manager (as shown in the screenshot below).

Could you please advise:

Are there any prerequisites or configurations required to make the UDO or add-on appear in the Report and Layout Manager?

What should be the correct add-on type or setup to enable layout imports for UDO screens?

 

Thanks in advance

SAP Business One  SAP Business One, version for SAP HANA

entry.title: Codigo de clasificación en dato maestro de artículo no sale completo
entry.content:
Saludos, 

Tengo un detalle en el dato maestro de articulo, en el campo código de clasificación,  la tabla en SAP B1 sale vacia, sin embargo si hago una consulta en SQL de la tabla ONCM si tiene registros.

Los que se muestran en la captura de pantalla los he agregado manualmente,  pero deberia salir llena la tabla desde que se crea la base de datos. 

la versión de sap que estoy trabajado es "SAP Business One 10.0 (10.00.191) FP 2202 (64-bit)"

También hay que comentar, que la base se hizo con la herramienta Solution Pakage en SQL. 

Espero alguien me pueda orientar.
